title: Can Spectate but not play?
body:
At the moment I am unable to get past the champion select screen, it just gives me the firewall error
However I can spectate my friends games.
Solutions anyone?

replies.body:
Well, considering the spectate feature uses a different server to the play server, the availability of one will not give insight to the availability to the other **but** it does confirm that this is not a hardware issue. In other words, spectate is not related to play.

What OS are you on, and who's your ISP?

I'm on Windows 7 
Telstra is
It was working fine on my old hard drive but that one got corrupted and I had to buy a new one and it hasn't worked since
No idea what's wrong O.o

That could have spawn from using a different configuration on the new OS. Did you change any settings on your old OS at any point?

Or did you just transfer the content of the old drive to the new one?

I started from scratch, my old hard drive was corrupted beyond repair
Everything that I have now is whatever settings windows 7 had from the start
Albeit disabling firewalls and other things that normally stop games from connecting to the internet

If that's truly the case, then your "Internet Options" would not be configured to correctly work with League. Open up Internet Explorer, go into its options and then go to "Security level" and set it to "Medium-Low". That should fix up League.

Best of luck!

It didn't fix it :/
Same firewall error

100% sure it's something to do with my hardware, when i connect my phone and use my 3g internet on my computer, I still run into the same issues
I have tried changing my DNS but it hasn't worked

Well, no matter how you connect, things like firewalls and anti-viruses will still act the same. I'm pretty sure that isn't the case but for things that work on a similar level it's true.

What is your process list? Could you bring that up?
